messages.message: Hey team - should we still use the Google form for the 'Provide feedback' link in Build? It would be ideal if all support/feedback requests were routed through Zendesk (https://support.instabase.com/hc/en-us/requests/new), so we had a more formal follow-up process.
We originally didn't do this because the CS team wanted only paying customers to be using Zendesk

@jack.robbins All AI Hub Ent/commercial customer issues should be routed through Zendesk. Based on the support tier chosen by the customer, the CE team will prioritize tickets according to our Support Policy (https://instabase.com/support-policy/).
*Prerequisites for AI Hub support:*
1. Zendesk Onboarding of new AI Hub customers. Please see the confluence page (https://instabase.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/CE/pages/2419294209/Welcome+Onboarding+Process+for+AI+hub+Enterprise+Commercial+Customers+to+CE+team) for the onboarding details.
2. Onboarding is NOT required for existing/migrating customers from the Instabase Platform to AI Hub who are already using Zendesk.
Please refer to the Confluence page (https://instabase.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/CE/pages/2420342902/Instabase+AI+Hub+Zendesk+Best+Practices) for Zendesk sign-up, ticket submission & best practices.
Community users will continue to use “Provide Feedback” option.
Thanks for taking a look - the feedback that triggered this was from a user at Loctax (https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C059K24M35E/p1726492162434059), which should be a commercial customer.

Hey! I think the action item here is that for commercial/enterprise customers "provide feedback" should be "support" for community customers we can keep as it.

This matches the implementation that we have  on the tab nav you see can support for commercial org and then provide feedback for our community accounts.

Can we make sure it's the same in the side navs across the platform? This will make it so that all commercial/enterprise reqs are always pushed through zendesk for triage.
@Xindi Xu I think you might have implemented this to begin with - any chance we might be able to make this quick fix?

One thing to be aware of is that even if we make this quick fix, the "Report bug" option in the toast would still use the Google form - it would be possible but a little more involved to make sure things are autofilled in the zendesk
Ideally we could do that in future, but not a blocker for this!
